statements: SELECT * FROM access_control;
SELECT user_id, username, role FROM access_control WHERE role='Admin';
SELECT username, role FROM access_control WHERE user_id=1;
SELECT * FROM access_control WHERE user_id=1 AND permissions CONTAINS 'write';
SELECT user_id, username FROM access_control WHERE role IN ('Admin', 'Manager');
SELECT * FROM access_control ORDER BY username ASC, user_id DESC, role
SELECT user_id, username FROM access_control WHERE role = 'Admin' AND username LIKE '%Smith%' ORDER BY user_id DESC
SELECT user_id, role, ARRAY_LENGTH(permissions) AS num_permissions FROM access_control WHERE num_permissions > 3 ORDER BY num_permissions DESC, role
SELECT DISTINCT role, COUNT(user_id) AS num_users FROM access_control GROUP BY role HAVING num_users > 1 ORDER BY num_users DESC
SELECT username, role FROM access_control WHERE role IN ('Editor', 'Viewer') AND username IS NOT NULL ORDER BY username DESC
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT username, role FROM users WHERE role = 'admin';
SELECT id, username FROM users ORDER BY username DESC;
SELECT permission_name FROM permissions WHERE role = 'user';
SELECT * FROM users INNER JOIN permissions ON users.role = permissions.role;
SELECT id, username, role FROM users WHERE id = 1;
SELECT * FROM permissions WHERE role = 'admin';
SELECT id, role, username FROM users WHERE role = 'user' ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT permission_id, permission_name FROM permissions WHERE permission_id > 5 ORDER BY permission_id ASC;
SELECT username FROM users INNER JOIN permissions ON users.role = permissions.role WHERE permissions.permission_id = 10;
SELECT * FROM users ORDER BY user_id DESC;
SELECT username, role FROM users WHERE role='Admin';
SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE user_id IN (1, 3, 5);
SELECT * FROM roles WHERE role_name='Manager';
SELECT role_id, role_name, permissions FROM roles ORDER BY role_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE role='Admin';
SELECT role_name, permissions FROM roles WHERE role_id > 2 ORDER BY role_name DESC;
SELECT user_id, username, role_name FROM users u JOIN roles r ON u.role = r.role_name WHERE u.user_id = 1;
SELECT role_id, COUNT(permission) AS num_permissions FROM role_permissions GROUP BY role_id HAVING num_permissions > 3 ORDER BY num_permissions DESC;
SELECT * FROM users
SELECT username, role FROM users
SELECT id, username, role FROM users WHERE role = 'admin'
SELECT id, permission_name FROM permissions
SELECT role_name, permission_name FROM roles JOIN role_permissions ON roles.id = role_permissions.role_id JOIN permissions ON role_permissions.permission_id = permissions.id
SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = 1;
SELECT username, role FROM users JOIN roles ON users.role = roles.role_name WHERE roles.id = 2;

SELECT username, role, permission_name FROM users JOIN roles ON users.role = roles.role_name JOIN role_permissions ON roles.id = role_permissions.role_id JOIN permissions ON role_permissions.permission_id = permissions.id WHERE role_permissions.permission_id = 3;
SELECT id, username, role FROM users WHERE role = 'Admin' ORDER BY id DESC;

SELECT username, role, permission_name FROM users JOIN roles ON users.role = roles.role_name JOIN role_permissions ON roles.id = role_permissions.role_id JOIN permissions ON role_permissions.permission_id = permissions.id WHERE users.id > 3;
SELECT * FROM users
SELECT user_id, username, role FROM users
SELECT role_id, role_name FROM roles ORDER BY role_name DESC
SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE role='Admin'

SELECT user_id, username, permission_name FROM users JOIN user_roles ON users.user_id = user_roles.user_id JOIN role_permissions ON user_roles.role_id = role_permissions.role_id JOIN permissions ON role_permissions.permission_id = permissions.permission_id
SELECT * FROM users
SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE role='admin'

SELECT u.username, r.role_name, p.permission_name FROM users u JOIN user_roles ur ON u.user_id = ur.user_id JOIN roles r ON ur.role_id = r.role_id JOIN role_permissions rp ON r.role_id = rp.role_id JOIN permissions p ON rp.permission_id = p.permission_id
SELECT COUNT(user_id) AS total_users FROM users
SELECT * FROM roles JOIN user_roles ON roles.role_id = user_roles.role_id ORDER BY role_name DESC
